**Gender Related Laws and Policies in Ghana**

The country has enacted laws and developed policies that have ensured non-discrimination based on sex. The laws and policies also cater for and enhance equality among the sexes. 

- [Commission on Human Rights and Administrative Justice Act, 1993 (Act 456)](https://chraj.gov.gh/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/ACT-456.pdf)

- [Domestic Violence Act, 2007 (Act 732)](https://evaw-global-database.unwomen.org/-/media/files/un%20women/vaw/full%20text/africa/ghana%20-%20domestic%20violence%20act%20(2007).pdf?vs=3618)

- [Labour Act, 2003 (Act 651)](https://www.ilo.org/dyn/natlex/docs/SERIAL/66955/63431/F1429852156/GHA66955.pdf)

- [National Gender Policy, 2015](https://www.mogcsp.gov.gh/mdocs-posts/national-gender-policy/)

- [National Housing Policy, 2015](https://www.mwh.gov.gh/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/national_housing_policy_2015-1.pdf)

- [National Social Protection Policy](https://www.mogcsp.gov.gh/mdocs-posts/ghana-national-social-protection-policy/)

- [Justice for Children Policy](https://www.mogcsp.gov.gh/mdocs-posts/justice-for-children-policy/)

- [Ghanap 2](https://www.mogcsp.gov.gh/mdocs-posts/ghana-national-action-plan-ghanap2/)

- [Five Year Strategic Plan](https://www.mogcsp.gov.gh/mdocs-posts/five-year-strategic-plan-for-gender-statistics/)

- [Human Trafficking National Plan of Action](https://www.mogcsp.gov.gh/mdocs-posts/human-trafficking-national-plan-of-action/)
